'''Anita Alvarez''' is the [[Cook County State's Attorney]].<ref>[http://www.statesattorney.org/index2/index.html ''Message from the State's Attorney'' www.statesattorney.org Retrieved: 2010-04-08.]</ref><ref>[http://www.nbcchicago.com/news/local-beat/States-Attorney-Aims-at-Public-Officials-Who-Condone-Sex-Trafficking-85201752.html ''Chicago Girls Practicing "Survival Sex"'' www.nbcchicago.com Retrieved: 2010-04-08.]</ref><ref>[http://www.elections.state.il.us/CampaignDisclosure/CommitteeDetail.aspx?id=20758 ''Friends of Anita Alvarez Purpose: to support Anita Alvarez for public office'' www.elections.state.il.us Retrieved: 2010-04-08.]</ref> Alvarez is the "first [[Hispanic and Latino Americans|Hispanic]] woman" elected to this position.<ref>[http://www.chicagobreakingnews.com/2008/12/anita-alvarez-cook-states-attorney.html ''Alvarez sworn in as state's attorney'' www.chicagobreakingnews.com Retrieved: 2010-04-08.]</ref> She also was the "first Latina" to win the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] [[nomination]] for state attorney of [[Cook County, Illinois|Cook County]].<ref>[http://www.dailyherald.com/story/?id=129487&src=1 ''Alvarez get Democrat nod for Cook County state's attorney'' www.dailyherald.com Retrieved: 2010-04-08.]</ref><ref>[http://cbs2chicago.com/politics/alvarez.states.attorney.2.646855.html ''Alvarez Wins Democratic State's Attorney Race'' cbs2chicago.com Retrieved: 2010-04-08.]</ref>

== 2008 General Election == Anita Alvarez was elected as Cook County State's Attorney in November 2008. Alvarez faced two challengers from both the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] and [[Green Party (United States)|Green Party]] in November 2008's general election. The two challengers were [[Cook County Board of Commissioners|Cook County Commissioner]] for the 16th district [[Tony Peraica]], and the Green Party's [[Thomas O'Brien (politician)|Thomas O'Brien]].

==Awards==
In 2001, Alvarez was honored as Person of the Year by Chicago Lawyer magazine.<ref>[http://www.anitaalvarez2008.com/general/meet-anita/ ''Meet Anita'' www.anitaalvarez2008.com Retrieved: 2010-04-08.]</ref>
In 2009, Alvarez received an honor from the [[March of Dimes]] at its annual breakfast.<ref>[http://www.earthtimes.org/articles/show/the-march-of-dimes-honors,1014252.shtml ''The March of Dimes Honors Tammy Duckworth, Anita Alvarez and Kwame Raoul at its Annual 'Faces of Our Success' Awards Breakfast in Chicago'' www.earthtimes.org Retrieved: 2010-04-08.]</ref>
==Criticism== Alvarez has been intensely criticized by groups concerned with wrongful convictions. In 2011, the [[Innocence Project]] launched a petition criticizing her refusal to act on new DNA evidence that exonerates nine men convicted of rapes and homicides, five of whom remain incarcerated. <ref>[https://secure2.convio.net/ip/site/Advocacy?cmd=display&page=UserAction&id=223 ''Help Free Five Innocent Men'' https://secure2.convio.net/ip/site/Advocacy?cmd=display&page=UserAction&id=223 Retrieved: 2011-09-23.]</ref> <ref>[http://www.change.org/innocence_project ''http://www.change.org/innocence_project'' http://www.change.org/innocence_project Retrieved: 2011-09-23.]</ref>
==Early life== Alvarez graduated from [[St. Paul - Our Lady of Vilna School]] in Chicago. She attended [[Loyola University Chicago]] as an undergraduate, and [[Chicago-Kent College of Law]] as a law student.<ref>[http://www.nationaljournal.com/img/pdfs/090508_Alvarezbio.pdf '' Anita Alvarez'' www.nationaljournal.com Retrieved: 2010-04-08.]</ref>
==Current Work== Anita Alvarez is currently pursuing charges against Tiawanda Moore who is being charged with recording a police officer's inappropriate sexual advances towards her. According to the Huffington Post "When Chicago police answered a domestic disturbance call at the home of Tiawanda Moore and her boyfriend in July 2010, the officers separated the couple to question them individually. Moore was interviewed privately in her bedroom. According to Moore, the officer who questioned her then came on to her, groped her breast and slipped her his home phone number."<ref>{{cite web|title=Huffington Post|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/06/08/chicago-district-attorney-recording-bad-cops_n_872921.html?ref=fb&src=sp|work=Chicago State's Attorney Lets Bad Cops Slide, Prosecutes Citizens Who Record Them|accessdate=9 June 2011}}</ref> In Illinois it is against the law to record anyone, audio or visual, without his or her consent.
